adjective.description: Resembling a rod; rod-shaped, rodlike; (Zoology) of or relating to rod-like structures secreted by turbellarian flatworms.
Pathology. Characteristic of or resembling a rhabdomyosarcoma.

noun.description: Zoology. Any of the small rodlike structures which are secreted by the epidermis of turbellarian flatworms and dissolve to form a protective coating of mucus.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From post-classical Latin rabdoides from Hellenistic Greek ῥαβδοειδής striped from ancient Greek ῥάβδος rod + -οειδής.
